result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin H Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Cargo Portion of Truck/Trailer [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Olson to 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  4 years .  This sentence is consecutive to any sentence in being.

**Per Court's 4/12/19 Order: Please Amend JOC to State a total of 396 days credit.**

Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief
DOC Balance Inquiry

[MK] case called at 9:48am. 
Defendant Justin H Olson in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph M Ricker.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent Michael Ellestad is in court. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Olson to 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  4 years .  This sentence is consecutive to any sentence in being.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 391 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment & follow through with all recommended treatment per Agent
--to submit to and cooperate with any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by Agent
--no contact with Wade Rudoll
--no presence at King Blunder Enterprises
--to maintain employment
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid presciption 
--to take all prescribed controlled substances only as prescribed by a treating physician
--no possession of drug paraphernalia, to include syringes unless medically prescribed
--to submit to alcohol and drug testing at the direction of the Agent
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes, and except for incidental contact as part of employment or any education program, and except as otherwise deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to pay the balance due on restitution [originally the restitution amount was established to be $1350, payable to King Blunder Enterprises (c/o Craig Lang), joint & several with Wade Rudoll]
--to pay the balance due on court financial obligations


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:08am

Case called at 1:18 pm [Clerk SH] 
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Justin H Olson in court with Attorney Jeremy C. Evans. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 & #3
DA Happ submits victim impact statement & restitution information

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, concurrent with any other probation term, with conditions:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 8/21/15 at 7:00 pm 
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To submit to and cooperate with any other assessment, treatment or counseling, per Agent
--To maintain employment
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay restitution of $1350, payable to King Blunder Enterprises (c/o Craig Lang), joint & several with Wade Rudoll
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--No contact with Wade Rudoll
--No presence at King Blunder Enterprises

case called at 1:18pm [MK]
Defendant Justin H Olson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Olson verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Wade Rudoll, Lucas Kester, Scott Lange, or Craig Lange
--no presence at KB Enterprises in Oakland
recess 1:22pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/4/15 at 8:40am [Clerk's post-hearing added note: the 10:00am pretrial time given out by the clerk during the hearing was in error; the pretrial time on 3/4/15 is changed to 8:40am; the Scheduling Notice and Bond reflect the corrected 8:40am time]  (2) Status Conference in Branch III/Judge Wambach on 4/7/15 at 9:30am (with Co-Defendant's case #14CF49)--JA please note in comments that case is at Prelim stage
